intro: Koelreuteria arborescens, commonly known as the golden rain tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It is characterized by its showy, yellow panicles that bloom in late spring to early summer, creating a striking visual display. The plant has pinnately compound leaves that turn yellow in the fall, adding to its ornamental value. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for urban landscapes. The tree is also valued for its ability to tolerate air pollution and compacted soils.
